With everyone present in the room, Tucson slowly opens the door, and walks =
into it, with a stern but composed look on his face.  It was often a look t=
hat would come from the CMO, Ratchet when he was displeased about something=
.  Straight Shot reads the look well, and swallows hard.

Rattrap too, sens=
es that he is in for a major talking to, as he too remains quiet.  

Tucson=
 now takes his place at the head of the room, looking to all of them with a=
 quiet sigh.  But there was no mistake that he was not about to let anyone =
off the hook that fast.

" I'm sure you are all aware of why you are here. =
 What happened in the med bay was a bit disturbing and I need to address th=
at with all of you.  I'm not going to point fingers at just one of you, bec=
ause I know that all of you could have approached each other in a more civi=
lized manner."

Rattrap opens his mouth, but says nothing as Tucson holds u=
p a hand with that stern stare.

"Ulp, okay, Umm, yeah, I guess I just bett=
er keep my trap shut."

Straight Shot sinks in her chair.

" I hate it when=
 he has that look on his face."

Tucson now looks to her.

"I heard that.  =
Anyway, as I see it, all of you are having a problem with each other becaus=
e, in all truths, you really don't know each other as well as you think you=
 know.  Or else, you wouldn't be fighting as you have.  Now, I admit, I too=
, have jumped to conclusions and I have been wrong myself.  I'm going to wo=
rk very hard to try and correct that.  But I also need you three to try and=
 iron out any differences you have against each other.  Therefore, with the=
 mission as urgent as it is, I am assigning the three of you to work as a t=
eam throughout the time it takes to put these matters to rest."

Rattrap an=
d Straight Shot quickly gasp.

"WHAT?!"

Rattrap protests first.

" But, bu=
t, that talkn' go cart started it!  We didn't even say a word ta that littl=
e creepoid!"

Tucson's eyes narrow.

" Ahh, ahh ahh...  No. No one points f=
ingers at anyone.  This is NOT what this meeting is about.  I see I have my=
 work cut out for me..  And under no uncertain circumbstances are any of yo=
u allowed to fight against each other.  If I hear anything about any fighti=
ng among the three of you, there will be greater consequences to follow.  N=
ow, as of today, you are a team, and you will work as a team.  Am I underst=
ood?"

Rattrap and Straight Shot slouch in their chairs.

"Yes Sir."

Tucso=
n nods.

" Good.  Wheelie, you understand what I'm telling everyone right? =
 I'm not singling anyone out, I'm treating you all as equals.  I know you c=
an all get past this, it will take time but you can do it.  Now, Leo Prime,=
 perhaps you have an area you wish to assign them to?"

Straight Shot and R=
attrap look at each other.

"Trapped like rats.  Go figure?"

Straight Shot=
 Shrugs.

"Well, we had it comming Rattrap, we had it comming."

>
> 
> 
> --- In =
nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Sandy" <magicquartz@> wrote:
> >
> > Straight Shot=
 and Rattrap arrive at the ready room right on time as promised.  The knew =
they were in trouble for something the first time they had to report, told =
by Leo Prime.  They knew him well, and figured that they'd get a real earfu=
ll from him.  But then a second transmission told them that Tucson would be=
 talking to them instead.  Straight Shot looks to Rattrap a little concerne=
d.  She knew her brother well, and knew the tones of his voice when he was =
serious about something.  She takes a seat as does Rattrap, who had to have=
 the first word.
> > 
> > " I'm telln' ya this ain't fair, Straight Shot.  =
That little go cart started it.  He just had ta open his trap and now we're=
 in serious scrap for somethn' we so did not start!  It stinks like the tra=
sh compactor in the garbage bay!"
> > 
> > Straight Shot sighs.
> > 
> > " =
Tell me about it. And the worst part is, Tucson is giving the lecture.  I k=
now he's not gonna let anyone off easy, just by the tone of his voice, it s=
ounded serious.  I can't believe we're getting in trouble for sticking up f=
or ourselves.  What's so wrong about that?"
> > 
> > She shrugs, as Rattrap=
 sighs.
> > 
> > " Ya got me Prickles.  Oh yeah, your new nickname.  No off=
ense."
> > 
> > She smiles.
> > 
> > "Nah, none taken, I like it.  Prickles=
...  That's a new one." 
> > 
> > Rattrap tries to muster a smile.
> > 
> >=
 " Kinda like when I used ta call your brother, Wheels..  Hmm, now I think =
I better call him Wings.  They're big enough. Anyway, I wonder what he's go=
nna say ta us and what kinda punishments he's got planned. Ya know he's gon=
na do that, right?"
> > 
> > Straight Shot nodds.
> > 
> > "Yup.  Guess we =
just take what comes."
> > 
> > They now sit patiently and wait for Wheelie=
 to come in.
> >
> 
> 
> At this point, Wheelie walked over into the briefi=
ng room.  Glancing over at Rattrap and then over at Straight Shot, the smal=
l Survivor said nothing, merely going ovr to sit.
> 
> At this point, not s=
eein LEO PRIME or RODIMUS present, he quirked his head about.
> 
> Saying n=
othing, then going to sit back down as he gazed upon the others and waited =
for what they had all been called in for, not making conversation and stayi=
ng quiet.
>
